school_story_11.1_screen_1_title: What actually happens if you do not pay what you owe? This is different depending on  <bold>why</bold> you owe money!

school_story_11.1_screen_9_title: At this store you have 30 days to pay the invoice. But as you know, it can vary depending on which company you shop at.
school_story_11.1_screen_9_subtitle: What do you think they will do if you do not pay within 30 days?
school_story_11.1_screen_9_button_1_titl: They might... no, I do not know
school_story_11.1_screen_9_button_4_titl: They call and yell at me
school_story_11.1_screen_10_title: Yes, then they will send you a reminder.
school_story_11.1_screen_10_button_1_tit: Ok, that doesn't sound too bad...
school_story_11.1_screen_11_title: Well, that might not be so awful. But.
school_story_11.1_screen_11_subtitle: Because it means extra work for the company to send out the reminder, they charge for it. A reminder fee.
school_story_11.1_screen_12_title: Yes, that's how it is. Because you were liable for payment. Reminder fees are usually around 60 pb.
school_story_11.1_screen_12_subtitle: The game you bought cost 200 pb. How big is your debt now?
school_story_11.1_screen_13_subtitle: What do you think will happen if you do not pay your debt now?
school_story_11.1_screen_14_title: Then they will send another reminder.
school_story_11.1_screen_14_subtitle: Sometimes that also costs a fee, but usually not.
school_story_11.2_screen_1_title: We will continue where we left off; the company had sent two reminders and you still haven't paid.
school_story_11.2_screen_1_subtitle: The company you owe, can now turn to another company to help them to make you pay your debt.
school_story_11.2_screen_2_title: They are now sending your debt to a debt collection agency.
school_story_11.2_screen_2_subtitle: Debt collectors help companies send debt reminders.
school_story_11.2_screen_3_title: And now your debt will get even higher! A reminder fee from a debt collection agency costs 180 pb.
school_story_11.2_screen_3_subtitle: Your debt was already up to 260 pb. 200 pb for the game and 60 pb in reminder fee from the company. How much will it be now?
school_story_11.2_screen_4_subtitle: So your debt has increased from 200 pb to 440 pb. Just because you didn't pay.
school_story_11.2_screen_5_title: That's not good at all, if you don't pay it becomes expensive! And if you still do not pay, the debt will pass on to the Enforcement Agency.
school_story_11.2_screen_5_subtitle: It can have consequences in the long run, but we'll talk about that after the challenge, my carrots are boiling over!
school_story_11.2_screen_5_button_4_titl: Thought you were a pig, not a rabbit...
school_story_11.2_screen_6_title: Let's go on to what happens if you do not pay your bills.
school_story_11.2_screen_6_subtitle: Last story we ended up being sent to the debt collection agency. Remember?
school_story_11.2_screen_7_title: In our example, the company you owed money to sent two reminders, and then contacted a debt collection agency.
school_story_11.2_screen_7_subtitle: Your debt increased from 200 pb for the purchase, to 440 pb when reminder fees and debt collection claims were added to it.
school_story_11.2_screen_9_title: But what do you think will happen if you still don't pay the debt?
school_story_11.2_screen_10_title: There may be even more fees from the debt collection agency, or they may choose to engage the Enforcement Authority.
school_story_11.2_screen_11_title: The Enforcement Authority is a government agency which has two tasks. The first is to help those who need help collecting a debt that someone doesn't pay.
school_story_11.2_screen_11_subtitle: The other is to provide support and advice to those who need to pay a debt they have.
school_story_11.2_screen_12_title: When the Enforcement Authority has taken over a case, you get a payment demand. And this you also have to pay for.
school_story_11.2_screen_12_subtitle: If it has gone this far, you now owe the company 440 pb and the Enforcement Authority 680 pb. How much will it be?
school_story_11.2_screen_13_title: The answer is 1 120 pb. If you pay everything now, both the debt to the company and what you owe the Enforcement Authority, then nothing more happens.
school_story_11.2_screen_13_subtitle: But keep in mind that you owed almost 6 times what the purchase of 200 pb cost, because you did not pay earlier.
school_story_11.2_screen_14_title: What if you received one of these demands or debt collection claims without owing money? Then you have to tell them it's not correct. That is called to dispute.
school_story_11.2_screen_14_subtitle: It is important to know that you can not just ignore the letters from debt collectors and the Enforcement Authority, instead you must dispute it in time.
school_story_11.3_screen_1_title: We continue from when the Enforcement Authority has made a decision and decided that you have to pay. If you still don‚Äôt pay...
school_story_11.3_screen_1_subtitle: ...then there's another step. Something that can have larger consequences for you for a long time.
school_story_11.3_screen_2_title: The Enforcement Authority has the information that you have a debt with them and that it is not being paid.
school_story_11.3_screen_2_subtitle: That information is shared with something called a credit reference agency. A credit reference agency collects  information about everyone and keeps track of if you can handle your payments or not.
school_story_11.3_screen_3_title: When the credit reference agency has the information about an unpaid debt with the Enforcement Authority, you get a payment remark.
school_story_11.3_screen_3_subtitle: It is not good at all to get a payment remark. It stays for 3 years and makes it much harder for you to pay by invoice, get a cell phone plan or rent an apartment.
school_story_11.3_screen_4_title: It's serious not to pay your debts. Like I said, it can cost you a lot and have long-term consequences.
school_story_11.3_screen_4_subtitle: If you have larger debts, the Enforcement Authority also has the right to come to your home and sell your things to pay your debts.
school_story_11.3_screen_4_button_1_titl: Huh, how can they do that?
school_story_11.3_screen_4_button_2_titl: Yes, if you didn‚Äôt pay it‚Äôs not yours.
school_story_11.3_screen_5_title: Yes, it is so, if you have not paid, you do not own it. But let's summarise: If you do not pay on time, a debt of 200 pb can increase to 1120 pb.
school_story_11.3_screen_5_subtitle: And it can have consequences for several years, like a payment remark. So pay on time, it pays off!
school_story_11.3_screen_5_button_1_titl: Yes, just sounds stupid not to
school_story_11.3_screen_5_button_3_titl: I'll only shop if I can afford it!
school_story_11.3_screen_5_button_4_titl: I do not want a payment remark
school_story_11.3_screen_7_title: Now we will change the subject a bit. I want to ask you something!
school_story_11.3_screen_7_subtitle: Is there anything expensive that you would like to buy but can not afford?
school_story_11.3_screen_8_title: Yes I also have dreams about expensive stuff. I would like to buy a small moon orbiting the planet 578, to build a holiday house on.
school_story_11.3_screen_8_subtitle: But it's a big expense, and I'll save for some time before I can afford it.
school_story_11.3_screen_8_button_2_titl: A moon? I want one too!
school_story_11.3_screen_8_button_4_titl: Nothing is better than the archipelago!
school_story_11.3_screen_9_title: It is true that it is better to save up than to borrow, but sometimes you have to go for a different solution.
school_story_11.3_screen_9_subtitle: And loans for housing, for example, a lot of people take at some point in their lives, because there are very few who are able to save enough to buy a house.
school_story_11.3_screen_10_title: If, for example, the refrigerator breaks and you do not have a buffer saved, you can‚Äôt afford it. But without a refrigerator life gets a little less comfortable.
school_story_11.3_screen_10_subtitle: When you don‚Äôt have the money to pay for the purchase directly, there are many companies that allow you to buy it in instalments.
school_story_11.3_screen_10_button_1_tit: I think I know what that is
school_story_11.3_screen_11_title: Buying in instalments means that you don‚Äôt pay the full amount at the same time. Instead, the company divides it into several smaller payments over a certain period of time.
school_story_11.3_screen_11_subtitle: It is often easier to pay a small amount each month when you receive a salary, because you need to keep money from the salary for regular costs as well.
school_story_11.3_screen_12_title: Let's try to count. If you wanted to buy something for 10 000 pb in instalments, and had 10 months to pay,
school_story_11.3_screen_12_subtitle: how much do you have to pay per month?
school_story_11.3_screen_13_title: If the company doesn‚Äôt charge any fees, the correct answer would be: 1 000 pb/month.
school_story_11.3_screen_13_subtitle: But when paying in instalments, interest and other fees are often added, which makes it more expensive than paying directly. So you should try to have that savings buffer...
school_story_11.3_screen_13_button_2_tit: Savings buffer is a good idea
school_story_11.3_screen_14_title: In any case, in order to be allowed to buy in instalments, or take a loan from the bank, the company would like to see if they think you will pay what you owe.
school_story_11.3_screen_14_subtitle: Both loans and instalments are paid after you have received what you bought, in retrospect, and if they think you will not pay, companies or banks don‚Äôt want to agree to it.
school_story_11.4_screen_1_title: It can be tricky to know if someone will pay or not, but there is a way for companies and banks to find out information about your previous payments.
school_story_11.4_screen_2_title: They can ask for a credit reference on you via a credit reference agency. There are about 10 credit reference agencies in Sweden, one of them is UC.
school_story_11.4_screen_3_title: The credit report contains information about your finances. It‚Äôs like a personal finance history.
school_story_11.4_screen_3_subtitle: For example, it says how much you earn if you have a job. If you already have a loan, they are listed here and this is also where payment remarks come in.
school_story_11.4_screen_4_title: Yes, this is where the payment remarks end up.On the credit references of companies like UC, who deal with this.
school_story_11.4_screen_4_button_1_titl: But what is a payment remark?
school_story_11.4_screen_6_title: If you have had debts you have not paid, it is important information for other companies to know. This is why a payment remark can affect whether you get a bank loan, for example.
school_story_11.4_screen_7_title: In order for companies to easily understand whether you will be able to pay or not, a number is calculated for your finances.
school_story_11.4_screen_7_subtitle: The number is between 0 and 100, because it is a percentage.
school_story_11.4_screen_7_button_2_titl: A number is easy to understand!
school_story_11.4_screen_8_title: The estimated percentage of your finances is called the credit risk score.
school_story_11.4_screen_8_subtitle: The credit risk score describes how great the risk is that you will not pay a debt and receive a payment remark within 1 year.
school_story_11.4_screen_9_title: If you have a low credit risk score, a low figure, it means that you handle your payments well. So companies and banks don‚Äôt have to be worried that you will not pay them.
school_story_11.4_screen_9_subtitle: But, if you have a high figure in the credit risk score, they will not trust you to pay what you owe.
school_story_11.4_screen_9_button_3_titl: I understand, they don‚Äôt want to risk it
school_story_11.4_screen_10_title: A high number can mean that you had a lot of loans or payment remarks in the past. But it could also be that your income is too low.
school_story_11.4_screen_10_subtitle: That is, either you don‚Äôt have job or the job you have gives a low salary, and therefore probably can not afford to pay off the loan or debt.
school_story_11.4_screen_11_title: The important thing is that a credit reference helps companies decide if there‚Äôs a high or a low risk of not being paid for their service or product.
school_story_11.4_screen_11_subtitle: This means that people are not allowed to borrow more than they can afford, which is great because then they don‚Äôt end up in major debts and problems!
